div.head: CHAP. XXIV.
1 Gods Lordship in the world. 3 The citizens of his spirituall kingdome. 7 An exhortation to receiue him.
div.ab: [A Psalme of Dauid.] The earth is the Lords, and the fulnesse thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein. Deut.10. 14 Iob. 41.2. psal. 50.12. 1.Cor.10. 26 & 28.
For he hath founded it vpon the seas, and established it vpon the floods. Iob 38.6. psal.104.5. & 136.6.
Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? and who shall stand in his holy place? Psal.15.1.
He that hath cleane hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lift vp his soule vnto vanitie, nor sworne deceitfully. Esa.23. 15.16. , Heb. the cleane of handes.
Hee shall receiue the blessing from the Lord, and righteousnesse from the God of his saluation.
This is the generation of them that seeke him: that seeke thy face, O Iacob. Selah. Or, O God of Iacob.
Lift vp your heads, O yee gates, and be ye lift vp ye euerlasting doores; and the King of glory shall come in.
Who is this king of glory? the Lord strong & mightie, the Lord mighty in battell.
Lift vp your heads, O ye gates, euen lift them vp, ye euerlasting doores; and the king of glory shall come in.
Who is this king of glory? the Lord of hostes, he is the king of glory. Selah.
